instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN: What is EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN? EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN is necessary to enable the power rail that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Video on internal Display. External works fine.
threads.message:
Hi 
There are no evidance of liquid damaged on this mac.
How ever internal display doesnt work. works only with external display.
Board side LCD connector looks fine. How ever <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> signal is missing and PP5V-<SIGNAL>S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> is 0.v

Seams like <CHIP>U9800</CHIP> not sending <SIGNAL>PANEL_EN</SIGNAL>. When I look only input signla on <CHIP>U9800</CHIP> which thought relavent to get <SIGNAL>PANEL_EN</SIGNAL> is <SIGNAL>EDP_IG_PANEL_EN</SIGNAL> inout 
signal and its present 3.3v. But im not sure about what siganl need to shoot PAnel _En.

Any help greatly appriciate.

THank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Video on internal Display. External works fine.
threads.message:
HI UPDATED.

This is fixed. Thank you
